wikipedia_page.main: Alexander William Duncan (19 June 1881 – 18 November 1934) was a Scottish international rugby and cricket player.He was capped for Scotland between 1901-2. He also played for University of Edinburgh RFC.He also played for the Scotland national cricket team.

response: *Alexander William Duncan (1881–1934), Scottish cricketer and rugby player

link_mentions.page: List of Scottish rugby union players

response: Welsh played for Edinburgh University.The Essential History of Rugby UNion:Scotland. Nick Oswald and John Griffiths. Headline Publishing. 2003 He was part of a famous University back line in 1901–02 season: Alec Boswell Timms, James Barnett Allison (of Ireland), and Alfred Fell together with Welsh and Alexander William Duncan at Full Back. The half back pairing of Ernest Simson and Frank Fasson completed the international line-up of backs.
